page.title: 20OLD HORRABRIDGE
page.content: Mrs Youlden's grandfather and father worked as the village blacksmiths ,here's what she said they used to do. "Shoeing horses, making iron bars, special irons bars for protecting people. They used to make iron hoops for the little boys.And if they got broken they would mend them.The boys used to like to come into the blacksmithshop and blow the bellows, and they would like to see all the sparks flying". The blacksmith shop is now just a boarded up shed rarely used. "Mr.Dickiwinters,the Headmaster of the school,had a mallaca cane for naughty boys!The girls played skipping ,rounders & hopscotch,and they also had wooden hoops while the boy's played football of course and the game called "Jumpback".
